page.title: 15Arts and Crafts
page.content: {Tintagel Pottery}is in the grounds of Bossiney Court,an old Norman manor.It was started in 1948.The pottery has distinctive patterns.These patterns have different meanings - an upright stroke represents man,a circle represents woman,the waving line represents progress and the apple and dragon are connected to the Arthurian Legend.The colours used are white, green,purple,yellow and red.The pottery makes coffee sets,jugs,mugs, ashtrays,dishes,salt and pepper sets, egg cups and bowls.These are sold to shops in an area from the Lizard to Dundee.The prices range from 60p to Â£25.00.
